Text.Text: Bah!  I couldn't care less about Yquog eating Krunbar - Krunbar was an idiot!  The thing I'm livid about is the fact Yquog took Krunbar's enchanted bracers after he ate him.  The bracers should go to ME!
Isn't it obvious?  Retrieve Krunbar's bracers, give them to me, and I'll give you the note with Yquog's message.
Typical!  Nothing's for free, eh?!  Very well.  Get my bracers back - and I don't care how you do it - and I'm sure I can dig up something magical that will tickle your greedy fancy.
Fine!  Just make sure the next time you show your face to me, you have my bracers.  If not, I'll kill the lot of you and feed my clan with your flesh.  Now get out of here before I get nasty!
You!  You're not part of Yquog's miserable minions!  Who are you, and how did you get past Yquog's lackeys?
Killed him and his entire brood, you say?  I find that hard to believe.
Wait, perhaps I was too quick to judge.  It's obvious you must be an adventurer of some merit, otherwise you couldn't have gotten as far into these caverns as you have.
If what you say is true and Yquog is dead, then you must have found some special bracers on his dead body.  Did you find any?

Because they once belonged to my brother, Krunbar, but Yquog ate him and stole his bracers.  Now that he is dead, those bracers should go to me.  After all, I am Krunbar's living relative - it is my heirloom.
You don't have to believe me, <CHARNAME>!  However, if you don't want to get into another battle, you'll hand over my bracers.  They are mine and they are to stay within my family line!
Yes, excellent...  it's Krunbar's bracers!  You made a wise decision, <CHARNAME>, I will let you leave my camp in peace - and here, take this.

I suppose I could tell you, being as you returned what was rightfully mine.  You see, when I found out Yquog ate my brother and stole his bracers, I needed to find leverage to try and get the bracers back.

I had no desire to seek revenge for my brother - he was an idiot anyway.  My only concerns were getting back the bracers and hopefully doing it without a fight.  Being a barghest whelp, he and his minions were much too powerful for my small clan. And besides, he had a special link with the masters.
No!  I will not tell you about them!  I fear them much more than I feared Yquog - or you.

Shortly after my brother's demise, I intercepted a message scroll that was supposed to go to Yquog.  The message came from the masters, so I knew it had to be extremely important.  I withheld the message from Yquog, telling him that he would only get it when he returned my brother's bracers.

After Yquog ate my brother, the masters explicitly told all of us not to attack each other, under penalty of torture.  So instead of attacking me, Yquog set up a blockade that kept us from leaving to get food, water, and whatever else we needed to survive.

I know the message is written in some form of Abyssal that I have never seen before, and that is all that I can tell you.  Now, clear out whatever other creatures here you like, you'll get no interference from us.  My clan and I look forward to taking over these warrens for mining - and no longer being a part of this worthless war.
Ah, I could smell you coming.  Do you have my bracers?
Excellent!  That's them!  Very good!  Now I will fulfill my end of the deal.  Here, take Yquog's blasted message and this enchanted item, and be gone.

I know the message is written in some form of Abyssal that I have never seen before, and that is all that I can tell you.  Now, clear out whatever other creatures here you like, you'll get no interference from us.  My clan and I look forward to taking over these warrens for mining - and no longer being a part of this worthless war.
I have nothing more to say to you, <CHARNAME>.  You need to leave.
Bah!  I've had enough!  Begone!
What do you want?!
What do you want?!
You!  You're not part of Yquog's miserable minions!  Who are you, and how did you get past Yquog's lackeys?
Killed Yquog's guards, you say?  Impressive...  even for a surface dweller.  I could use a strong adventurer such as you to perform a task for me.

Not by choice - and none of my clan has yet to take up arms with anyone from the Ten-Towns.  We dekanter goblins are warriors, yes, but we are also adept miners.  We mine ore for this horde.  But enough of that!  Will you perform a simple task for me - and I'll let you leave in peace - or do we fight - my patience wears thin!
There is a barghest whelp in the warrens south of here - probably the very warrens you came from.  The whelp's name is Yquog, and he has something of mine that is very valuable to me.
The item is a pair of bracers that used to belong to my brother, Krunbar.  Yquog ate my brother and took the bracers - the bracers that I should inherit!

Bah!  I couldn't care less about Yquog eating Krunbar - Krunbar was an idiot!  The thing that angers me is the fact Yquog took Krunbar's enchanted bracers after he ate him and didn't return my rightful heirloom!
Your mastery of the obvious is mesmerizing, <CHARNAME>, I can see why you're the leader.  Yes!  Retrieve my bracers from Yquog!
Typical!  Nothing's for free, eh?!  Very well.  Get my bracers back - and I don't care how you do it - and I'm sure I can dig up something magical that will tickle your greedy fancy.
Fine!  Just make sure the next time you show your face to me, you have my bracers.  If not, I'll kill the lot of you and feed my clan with your flesh.  Now get out of here before I get nasty!
Yes, excellent...  it's his bracers!  You made a wise decision, <CHARNAME>, I will let you leave my camp in peace.

Yes, they were.  But you took care of that for me, and that's all I'm going to say about that.  Do as you like in these warrens, we will not interfere - we have no love for this lot.  And take this as a symbol of good faith.  Now go - your smooth skin is repulsive to me.
Stop!  If you've come to help me, then deal with those vermin following you first.  And see if they have my bracers!
Stop!  If you've come to help me, then deal with those vermin following you first.  And see if they have my bracers!
You!  You're not part of Yquog's miserable minions!  Who are you, and how did you get past Yquog's lackeys?
*Bargain?!*  How dare he think he can bargain after what he's done!
Ah, how moving to see such sibling apathy...  So, what is it going to take to get you to give me Yquog's message?
You don't deserve to live.  Die, you heartless scum!
So what do I get for being *your* errand-boy?
You know, I've played delivery courier far too many times recently, and here is where I stop!
Sounds fair.
Farewell.
I don't need this kind of abuse! Prepare to die!
I'm <CHARNAME>.  I killed Yquog, his minions, and his lackey guards who were blockading the northern and southern entrances.
Why should I tell you?  You won't live long enough to utter it!
Don't believe if you wish, it makes no difference to me.  I'll be on my way, then...
Really... well here, let me make you a believer...
And what if I did?  Why should I tell you?
No, no, we didn't find any bracers...  I don't know what you're talking about...
And why should I believe you?
And why should I believe you?
I earned those bracers when I defeated Yquog.  You'll not take them from me!
If it means that much to you, then here, take them.
I earned those bracers when I defeated Yquog.  You'll not take them from me!
I'll take that as a thank you.  But before I go, I do want to ask you a question; why were Yquog's guards at your camp entrance?  Were they blockading you?
You know, I earned those bracers when I defeated Yquog.  I want them back - and I'm going to take them by force!
Farewell.
The masters?
I have heard enough.  Farewell.
Fine, continue.
Then I have heard enough!  Farewell!
Then how about I beat it out of you!
Why didn't he just send his minions after you and take it by force?
You know, I changed my mind.  I really don't care about you, your bracers, or the conflict between Yquog and you.  Farewell.
You know, I really hate convoluted stories - and I'm really hating you, right now.  I believe your death is the only solution!
I guess we happened by just in time.  Would you at least tell us what is on the note?
I have heard enough.  Farewell.
Fine, we'll leave you in peace.  Farewell.
Yes, here.
No, not yet.
No deal.  Die, scum!
Thank you.  But, before I go, can you tell me what is on the message?
Farewell.
Thank you.  But, before I go, can you tell me what is on the message?
Farewell.
Farewell.
Are these the bracers you were referring to?
I'm <CHARNAME>.  I killed those whelps and trolls that were blocking the passageway.
I'm <CHARNAME>.  I killed Yquog, his minions, and his lackey guards who were blockading the southern entrance.
I'm <CHARNAME>.  I killed Yquog, his minions, and his lackey guards who were blockading the northern entrance.
I'm <CHARNAME>.  I killed Yquog, his minions, and his lackey guards who were blockading the northern and southern entrances.
Nothing, farewell.
Are these the bracers you were referring to?
Are these the bracers you were referring to?
Nothing, farewell.
I'm <CHARNAME>.  And if you're referring to those trolls and whelps down the passageway, I killed them.
Never mind.  Farewell.
A task?  Aren't you a part of this horde that has been laying siege to the Ten-Towns?
Foul creature, the only thing I'll do for you is accelerate your demise!
What is this task?
Foul creature, the only thing I'll do for you is accelerate your demise!
What is it and why is it so valuable?
I understand your hatred for Yquog.  I can't imagine how I would react if someone killed one of my siblings...
Ah, how moving to see such sibling apathy...  So, I take it you want me to retrieve the bracers?
You don't deserve to live.  Die, you heartless scum!
So what do I get for being *your* errand-boy?
You know, I've played delivery courier far too many times recently, and here is where I stop!
Sounds fair.
Are these the bracers you're looking for?
Not good enough.  I think I will settle for your clan's skulls, instead.
I shall return.
I don't need this kind of abuse!  Prepare to die!
I'll take that as a thank you.  But before I go, I do want to ask you a question; why were Yquog's guards at your camp entrance?  Were they blockading you?
You know, I earned those bracers when I defeated Yquog.  I want them back - and I'm going to take them by force!
Farewell.
Farewell.
I'm <CHARNAME>.  Yquog sent me to bargain for his message that you're holding.
Why should I tell you?  You won't live long enough to utter it!
I understand your hatred for Yquog.  I can't imagine how I would react if someone killed one of my siblings...
You're right, Kruntur, bargaining is not an option.  You will die and I will just take the message from your dead hands... er, claws.
